content.question: Two long, straight, current-carrying wires are parallel to each other in the plane of the page. The wires are a distance <math alttext="D " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>D</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> apart and carry a current <math alttext="I " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> toward the top of the page, as shown in the figure. Which of the following is a correct expression for the magnetic field midway between the wires?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 4 mu sub 0, end sub, I, over pi D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 2 mu sub 0, end sub, I, over pi D" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction mu sub 0, end sub, I, over pi D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>π</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction mu sub 0, end sub, I, over 2 pi D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>D</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 12.3: Magnetic Fields of Current-Carrying Wires and the Biot-Savart Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
